summary: Security Council Report's Feb 2026 forecast says NO initiatives to discuss Venezuela at the General Assembly as of late January 2026
content:
Key finding from Security Council Report February 2026 Monthly Forecast article titled "In Hindsight: The Security Council's Muted Response to the Venezuela Crisis":

The search result summary states: "About a month has passed since the US operation, which many describe as a seismic event, yet there have been no proposals for a Council product or a meeting to follow up on developments in the country. There have also been no initiatives to discuss the matter at the General Assembly."

This is a highly credible source that specifically tracks UN proceedings. Written for the February 2026 forecast (likely late January), it directly addresses the UNGA question.

Also notable: Some search engine AI summaries appear to conflate the 1989 Panama UNGA resolution vote (75-20-40) with the 2026 Venezuela situation. The 75-20-40 vote was for Resolution 44/240 on Panama, not any 2026 Venezuela resolution.

Historical precedents:
- Panama 1989: UNGA resolution adopted 9 days after invasion
- Grenada 1983: UNGA resolution adopted 8 days after invasion
- Venezuela 2026: No UNGA resolution even proposed as of ~late January
